intro: Guilielma caribaea, commonly known as the Caribbean guillemot, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline environments. Guilielma caribaea plays an important role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
